subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Pray for us. We are sure that we have a clear conscience and desire to live honorably in every way. I particularly urge you to pray so that I may be restored to you soon. (Heb. 13:18, 19) NIV
reflection: The writer here recognizes the need for prayer. Christian leaders are especially vulnerable to criticism from others, pride (if they succeed), depression (if they fail), and Satan's constant efforts to destroy their work for God. They desperately need our prayers! Think for a minute, for whom should you regularly pray???
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for the avenue of prayer. There are many whom need our prayers but so often we are so concerned about our own little problems that we forget to pray for those who really need our prayers. Forgive me Lord for this sin of omission. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~food for thought)~~~Be ye fishers of men. You catch them - He'll clean them...

Our Meditation for Today:

Pray for us. We are sure that we have a clear conscience
and desire to live honorably in every way...

I particularly urge you to pray so that I may be restored to 
you soon...(Heb. 13:18, 19) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

The writer here recognizes the need for prayer...

Christian leaders are especially vulnerable to criticism from others, 
pride (if they succeed), depression (if they fail), and Satan's constant
efforts to destroy their work for God...

They desperately need our prayers!

Think for a minute, for whom should you regularly pray???

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for the avenue of prayer.
There are many whom need our prayers but so often we
are so concerned about our own little problems that we forget
to pray for those who really need our prayers. Forgive me
Lord for this sin of omission...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: May the God of peace, who through the blood of the eternal covenant brought back from the dead our Lord Jesus, that great Shepherd of the sheep, equip you with everything good for doing His will, and may He work in us what is pleasing to Him, through Jesus Christ, to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen. (Heb. 13:20, 21) NIV
reflection: What we should see is that these verses include two significant results of Christ's death and resurrection. God works in us to make us the kind of people that would please Him, and He equips us to do the kind of work that would please Him. So let God change you from within and then use you to help others.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the results that were brought about by Christ's death and His resurrection. I pray that I would allow You to work in my heart that my life would be pleasing to You. I pray that I would allow You to use me as You wish. Bless and keep my e-mail friends healthy and safe. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Coincidence is when God chooses to remain anonymous...

Our Meditation for Today:

May the God of peace, who through the blood of the eternal
covenant brought back from the dead our Lord Jesus, that 
great Shepherd of the sheep,

equip you with everything good for doing His will, and may He 
work in us what is pleasing to Him, through Jesus Christ, to
whom be glory for ever and ever...Amen. (Heb. 13:20, 21) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

What we should see is that these verses include two significant 
results of Christ's death and resurrection...

God works in us to make us the kind of people that would please
Him, and He equips us to do the kind of work that would please
Him...

So let God change you from within and then use you to help others...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the results that were
brought about by Christ's death and His resurrection. I pray 
that I would allow You to work in my heart that my life would
be pleasing to You. I pray that I would allow You to use me 
as You wish...

Bless and keep my e-mail friends healthy and safe...Amen.

Keep Looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care... 
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Greet all your leaders and all God's people. Those from Italy send you their greetings. Grace be with you all. (Heb. 13:24, 25)
reflection: The book of Hebrew has been a call to Christian maturity. It was addressed to first-century Jewish Christians, but it applies to Christians of any age or background. Christian maturity means making Christ the beginning and the end of our faith. To grow in maturity we must center our life on Him, not depending on religious ritual, not falling back into sin, not trusting in ourselves, and not letting anything come between us and Christ. Christ is sufficient and superior.
prayer: Dear Lord, what a wonderful thought that comes to mind when I think about the Savior, He is the beginning and the end. What a difference when comparing this world where all we have here is temporary. I thank you for this relationship. Mt. 6:19-21 is so true, "Don't store up your treasures here; store them in heaven. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~ (food for thought)~~~Don't put a question mark where God has put a period...

Our Meditation for Today:

Greet all your leaders and all God's people. Those from Italy
send you their greetings...

Grace be with you all...(Heb. 13:24, 25)

Our Thought for Today:

The book of Hebrew has been a call to Christian maturity.
It was addressed to first-century Jewish Christians, but it
applies to Christians of any age or background...

Christian maturity means making Christ the beginning and 
the end of our faith. To grow in maturity we must center our
life on Him, 

not depending on religious ritual,
not falling back into sin,
not trusting in ourselves,
and not letting anything come between
us and Christ...

Christ is sufficient and superior...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord, what a wonderful thought that comes to mind
when I think about the Savior, He is the beginning and the 
end. What a difference when comparing this world where
all we have here is temporary...I thank you for this relationship.
Mt. 6:19-21 is so true, "Don't store up your treasures here;
store them in heaven...Amen.

This is the last devotional from Hebrews I will now start
with the book of Romans...

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, called to be an apostle, set apart for the gospel of God, Which He promised beforehand through His prophets in the Holy Scriptures, The gospel concerning His Son, who was descended from David according to the flesh And designated Son of God in power according to the Spirit of holiness by His resurrection from the dead, Jesus Christ our Lord. (Ro. 1:1-4)
reflection: Paul is quiet bold in his declaration of the greatness and certainty of his message. He claims a commission from God to deliver a message, "the gospel concerning His Son." Paul's emphases is that God sent His Son into the world to redeem mankind otherwise lost because of sin. Matthew also declared this in reviewing the genealogy of Jesus in (Mt 1:1-17). It is also John's premise when he declared that Jesus, the Word "became flesh and dwelt among us" Jn. 1:14). Is this difficult for you to believe? YES! Christ became incarnate to redeem those who would believe in Him. Because of this there are million both in this life and in eternity who raise their songs in praise to His saving grace.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You and praise You for Christ's redeeming power. I thank You for the promise of eternal life where there will be no more suffering or death. Where we will live eternally. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Don't wait for six strong men to take you to church...

Our Meditation for Today:

Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, called to be an apostle, set apart
for the gospel of God, 

Which He promised beforehand through His prophets in the Holy Scriptures, 

The gospel concerning His Son, who was descended from David according 
to the flesh 

And designated Son of God in power according to the Spirit of holiness by His 
resurrection from the dead, Jesus Christ our Lord...(Ro. 1:1-4) 

Our Thought for Today:

Paul is quiet bold in his declaration of the greatness and certainty
of his message. He claims a commission from God to deliver a
message, "the gospel concerning His Son."

Paul's emphases is that God sent His Son into the world to redeem
mankind otherwise lost because of sin...

Matthew also declared this in reviewing the genealogy of Jesus in 
(Mt 1:1-17).

It is also John's premise when he declared that Jesus, the Word
"became flesh and dwelt among us" Jn. 1:14).

Is this difficult for you to believe?

YES! Christ became incarnate to redeem those who would 
believe in Him...

Because of this there are million both in this life and in eternity
who raise their songs in praise to His saving grace...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You and praise You for
Christ's redeeming power. I thank You for the promise 
of eternal life where there will be no more suffering or
death. Where we will live eternally...Amen.

Keep looking up, toward the SON...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Through Christ, God has given us the privilege and authority to tell Gentiles everywhere what God has done for them, so that they will believe and obey Him, bringing glory to His name. (Ro. 1:5) NIV
reflection: We need to remember, that as Christians we have a privilege and a great responsibility. Paul and the apostles received the privilege of being called, but they also received the authority and the responsibility to share with others what God has done. God also graciously forgives our sins when we believe in Him as Lord. In doing this, we are committing ourselves to begin a new life. Paul's new life also involved a God-given responsibility: to witness about God's Good News to the world as a missionary. God may or may not call you to be a foreign missionary, but He does call you (and all believers) to be Christ's ambassador and to witness to the changed life that Jesus Christ has begun in you.
prayer: Dear Lord, because of Your name being glorified let Your mercy abound in me, to save me however unworthy I am. Sanctify me in Your Word for Your Word is true. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Without Christ there is no grace...

Our Meditation for Today:

Through Christ, God has given us the privilege and authority
to tell Gentiles everywhere what God has done for them, so
that they will believe and obey Him, bringing glory to His name.
(Ro. 1:5) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

We need to remember, that as Christians we have a privilege
and a great responsibility...

Paul and the apostles received the privilege of being called,
but they also received the authority and the responsibility to
share with others what God has done...

God also graciously forgives our sins when we believe in Him
as Lord. In doing this, we are committing ourselves to begin 
a new life...

Paul's new life also involved a God-given responsibility: to
witness about God's Good News to the world as a missionary.

God may or may not call you to be a foreign missionary, but
He does call you (and all believers) to be Christ's ambassador
and to witness to the changed life that Jesus Christ has begun
in you...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord, because of Your name being glorified let Your
mercy abound in me, to save me however unworthy I am.
Sanctify me in Your Word for Your Word is true...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Dear friends in Rome. God loves you dearly, and He has called you to be His very own people. May grace and peace be yours from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. (Ro. 1:7) NIV
reflection: All who are in Christ are entitled saints of God. There is no exception. There is no middle class. despite all degrees of sin among humans there are simply two classes in relation to God, namely, Christians and nonChristians, saints or sinners. Saintliness is the acceptance of Christ's merit and worthiness. It is being made the partaker of an inheritance otherwise not one's own. It is a gift of divine grace because even the most mature saints are not sinless and holy in themselves. Paul's greeting, "May grace and peace be yours from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ." has two directives."Grace" relates to the forgiveness of sins; "Peace" relates to a conscience free from unrest. When we have learned that no evil can befall us without the Father's knowledge, and that He wills only blessing for the believer, then there can be true peace of mind and heart. Our Lord spoke of this when He said, "Peace I leave with you; My peace I give to you" (Jn. 14:27).
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You for the assurance of the forgiveness of my sins, and the peace of mind that come with the forgiveness of my sins. I thank You too for the knowledge that no evil can come upon me with out your knowledge of it. Bless and protect my e-mail friends today. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Luther, "Grace and peace comprehend the whole Christian life."

Our Meditation for Today:

Dear friends in Rome. God loves you dearly, and He has called you
to be His very own people. May grace and peace be yours from God 
our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ...(Ro. 1:7) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

All who are in Christ are entitled saints of God. There is no
exception. There is no middle class...

despite all degrees of sin among humans there are simply 
two classes in relation to God, namely, Christians and nonChristians, saints or sinners...

Saintliness is the acceptance of Christ's merit and worthiness.
It is being made the partaker of an inheritance otherwise not 
one's own...

It is a gift of divine grace because even the most mature saints
are not sinless and holy in themselves...

Paul's greeting, "May grace and peace be yours from God our
Father and the Lord Jesus Christ." has two directives...

"Grace" relates to the forgiveness of sins; "Peace" relates to a 
conscience free from unrest...

When we have learned that no evil can befall us without the Father's 
knowledge, and that He wills only blessing for the believer, then
there can be true peace of mind and heart...

Our Lord spoke of this when He said, "Peace I leave with you; My
peace I give to you" (Jn. 14:27)...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord, I thank You for the assurance of the forgiveness
of my sins, and the peace of mind that come with the forgiveness
of my sins...I thank You too for the knowledge that no evil can
come upon me with out your knowledge of it...

Bless and protect my e-mail friends today...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I thank my God through Jesus Christ for all or you, because your faith is proclaimed in all the world. (Ro. 1:8) NIV
reflection: We can rejoice knowing that people are seeking Christ even though they are not free from faults. Children within a home are heirs at their birth. They are given parental love though there are differences in their ages, development, and personality. This is also true of the family of God. we are all beloved of God through Jesus Christ the Savior.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that my faith would be a witness of my love for You. I pray for Your guidance that my faith would always shine for You. Forgive me for all the times I have fallen short of the mark. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I long to see you, that I may impart some spiritual gift to strengthen you, that is, that we may be mutually encouraged by each other's faith, both yours and mine. (Ro. 1:11, 12)
reflection: As Paul, we should be hopeful that we can be used by God to assist others in further growth and nurture. One glowing ember will fire a weaker one next to it. The company of believers results in the infusing and infiltration of spiritual power among them.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the fellowship of other believers. I pray that I would be an encouragement to those who are troubled. Help me to be a glowing ember. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I am obligated both to the Greeks and non-Greeks, both the wise and to the foolish. (Ro. 1:14) NIV
reflection: Like with Paul, there should be an urgent compulsion in the heart of every believer to bring the Gospel to everyone regardless of their differences. . It should be our burning desire to bring the knowledge of our Lord's salvation to as many as possible regardless of their stature or station in life.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always be faithful in sharing the Gospel with all who will listen. Instill in me a sense of urgency in the need to share Your Word. Amen.

Keep looking Up, with an attitude of gratitude...

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I am not ashamed of the Gospel: it is the power of God for salvation to everyone who has faith, to the Jew first and also to the Greek. (Ro. 1:16)
reflection: There are many who regard the Gospel of Jesus Christ as foolishness. To be identified as a witness of the Gospel means that one may be counted as foolish, and persecution may follow. Paul knew the consequences of this identity with the Gospel and he was not ashamed. The Gospel of Christ demands unconditional surrender of the intellect and the will. Of course this is not pleasing to the nature of man. the independence that he loves so much is threatened. The Gospel is not loved by the unbelieving world. The main reason for Paul's boldness regarding the Gospel was that, "it is the power of God for salvation." The benefit of this power is received by "everyone who has faith."
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, give me the boldness and the wisdom to share the Gospel with those who regard it as foolishness. I pray that there would be a revival in the world, and let it start with me. Bless and protect my friends today. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought~~~The beneficiaries of the Gospel are those who believe...

I am not ashamed of the Gospel: it is the power of God for salvation

(Ro. 1:16)

Our Thought for Today:

To be identified as a witness of the Gospel means that one may be
counted as foolish, and persecution may follow...

Paul knew the consequences of this identity with the Gospel and he was
not ashamed...

The Gospel of Christ demands unconditional surrender of the intellect and
the will. Of course this is not pleasing to the nature of man. the independence
that he loves so much is threatened. The Gospel is not loved by the unbelieving 
world...

The main reason for Paul's boldness regarding the Gospel was that, "it is the
power of God for salvation." The benefit of this power is received by "everyone
who has faith."

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, give me the boldness and the wisdom

I pray that there would be a revival in the world, and let it start

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For in a righteousness from God is revealed, a righteousness that is by faith from first to last, just as it is written: "The righteous will live by faith. (Ro. 1:17) NIV.
reflection: What is being said is: the righteousness of God is made known through the Gospel. What a revelation this is! It is this, that Christ's merit is imputed to believers. It is a right given to believers, and it is the only righteousness that will stand valid before God. This plan was conceived in the mind of God in order to provide a way of righteousness for persons who would claim it, through members of a fallen race. This way of righteousness has been wrought for us through Jesus Christ. It is appropriated by faith, and by it a sinner is acquitted from all guilt. When a person accepts this righteousness offered by the Lord his name is entered into the book of life and he becomes an heir to eternal life.
prayer: I thank You Lord for the Gospel and the truth which is revealed in it. I thank You for providing a way for each believer to inherit eternal life. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~God grades on the cross, not the curve...

For in a righteousness from God is revealed, a righteousness

will live by faith...(Ro. 1:17) NIV...

the Gospel. What a revelation this is!

It is this, that Christ's merit is imputed to believers. It is a right given to
believers, and it is the only righteousness that will stand valid before God.

This plan was conceived in the mind of God in order to provide a way of
righteousness for persons who would claim it, through members of a fallen
race...

This way of righteousness has been wrought for us through Jesus Christ.
It is appropriated by faith, and by it a sinner is acquitted from all guilt...

When a person accepts this righteousness offered by the Lord his name

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The wrath of God is being revealed from heaven against all the godlessness and wickedness of men who suppress the truth by their wickedness. (Ro. 1:18) NIV
reflection: These words tell of impending judgement awaiting those who do not possess the righteousness that God provided through His Son, Jesus Christ. The need for the Gospel is made clear because we are informed of the need that is ours. Unless we have Christ we have the wrath of God hovering over us. This warning is made very clear in vs. 5 of chapter 2: "By your hard and impenitent heart you are storing up wrath for yourself on the day of wrath when God's righteous Judgement will be revealed."
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You again that the Gospel warns me of my need for repentance. So, I ask that You would forgive me of my sins of thought, word and deed. I thank You for the finished work of Christ on the cross. Amen.
original_content:

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Since the creation of the world God's invisible qualities, His eternal power and divine nature, have been clearly seen, being understood from what has been made, so that men are without excuse. (Ro. 1:20) NIV
reflection: What Paul is saying is that even the Gentiles possess a degree of knowledge that makes them responsible before God. The evidences and wonders of creation are so clear that even the non-Christian world can see God's power. This evidence is all the more impressive in contrast with the "ungodliness and the wickedness of men."
prayer: Dear heavenly Father, it is sad how some people try so frantically to explain away the creation of the word and all that is in it and even the existence of the human race. I thank You Lord for Your wisdom in creating all things, and Your sustaining power. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~You can tell how big a person is, 
by what it takes to discourage him...

Our Meditation for Today:

Since the creation of the world God's invisible qualities, His eternal
power and divine nature, have been clearly seen, being understood
from what has been made, so that men are without excuse...(Ro. 1:20) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

What Paul is saying is that even the Gentiles possess a degree of knowledge
that makes them responsible before God...

The evidences and wonders of creation are so clear that even the non-Christian
world can see God's power. This evidence is all the more impressive in contrast
with the "ungodliness and the wickedness of men."

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear heavenly Father, it is sad how some people try so frantically

in creating all things, and Your sustaining power...Amen.

Keep looking up, and give thanks for His sustaining power...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For although they knew God, they neither glorified Him as God, nor give thanks to Him, but their thinking became futile and their foolish hearts were darkened. (Ro. 1:21) NIV
reflection: God has given us the true Gospel. He has bestowed His grace upon us. He has placed before us the wonders of creation testifying to His majesty. He has given us His Son to become our brother, mediator, and redeemer. He met every demand of the law, and offered His blood to redeem us from sin and the curse. He has given us His Word, telling us all about it. Day by day He sends His Holy Spirit to nurture the life of godliness within us. But there are many who still follow their own desires, disregarding God's Word and His will. But God will deal with them according to the words of this text.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You for Your Word which makes it clear what Your will is for man-kind. I pray that those who seek their own desires would come to the knowledge of the truth and seek Your will for their lives. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~There are many, who follow their own desires,
disregarding God's Word and His will...

Our Meditation for Today:

For although they knew God, they neither glorified Him as God,

upon us. He has placed before us the wonders of creation testifying to His majesty...

He has given us His Son to become our brother, mediator, and 
redeemer. He met every demand of the law, and offered His blood
to redeem us from sin and the curse...

He has given us His Word, telling us all about it. Day by day He 
sends His Holy Spirit to nurture the life of godliness within us...

But there are many who still follow their own desires, disregarding 
God's Word and His will. But God will deal with them according to

and seek Your will for their lives...Amen.

Keep looking up, and follow His will...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Although they claim to be wise, they became fools and exchanged the glory of the immortal God for images made to look like mortal man and birds and animals and reptiles. (Ro. 1:22, 23) NIV
reflection: Through the ages the sin of pride has been unpleasing to God. Very often the most judicious minds and the most learned philosophers have fallen into gross foolishness when they have cast aside the fear of God in their claim to be wise. They have made fools of themselves, substituting all manner of idolatry in an effort to satisfy their religious hunger. One needs to be careful not to fall into the sin of pride, because more often than not that person will also casts aside God for some material object.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that my focus would always be on You. May my worship always be on You the creator and not on the created. I pray that my spiritual hunger would be on You O Lord. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~The sin of pride is in essence rebellion against God...

Our Meditation for Today:

Although they claim to be wise, they became fools and exchanged
the glory of the immortal God for images made to look like mortal
man and birds and animals and reptiles...(Ro. 1:22, 23) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Through the ages the sin of pride has been unpleasing to God.
Very often the most judicious minds and the most learned
philosophers have fallen into gross foolishness when they have
cast aside the fear of God in their claim to be wise...

They have made fools of themselves, substituting all manner of
idolatry in an effort to satisfy their religious hunger...

One needs to be careful not to fall into the sin of pride, because 
more often than not that person will also casts aside God for some 
material object...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that my focus would always be
on You. May my worship always be on You the creator and 
not on the created. I pray that my spiritual hunger would be
on You O Lord...Amen.

Keep looking up, then you are sure to be focused on Him...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Therefore God gave them over in the sinful desires of their hearts to sexual impurity for the degrading of their bodies with one another. They exchanged the truth of God for a lie, and worshiped and served created things rather then the creator, who is forever praised. Amen. (Ro. 1:24, 25) NIV
reflection: These words reveal the consequences of refusing to follow the gospel light that has been offered by our Lord. He simply leaves such stubborn ones to the lists of their own hearts. Powers of evil are so overwhelming to man that if the Lord forsakes him he will be immersed in all manner of sin and shame. If God did not check this deluge there could be no social order in existence. Even where the powers of grace are hindered God has provided checks against the destruction that wickedness causes. Some of these checks are common sense, fear of shame, fear of injury, and a desire for self-respect. But when the judgment of God is directed against gross wrongs of mankind He withholds the checks against the outbreak of sin. SO!!! Let us always give God the glory that is due Him.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that Your Holy Spirit will one day awaken these wayward ones, that they would turn from the lusts of their hearts. Help me to be mindful the give You the honor that is due You. Place your protective hand upon our troops--and my e-mail friends. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~We are to give God the glory that is due Him...

Our Meditation for Today:

Therefore God gave them over in the sinful desires of their hearts
to sexual impurity for the degrading of their bodies with one another.

They exchanged the truth of God for a lie, and worshiped and served
created things rather then the creator, who is forever praised...Amen.
(Ro. 1:24, 25) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

These words reveal the consequences of refusing to follow
the gospel light that has been offered by our Lord...

He simply leaves such stubborn ones to the lists of their own
hearts. Powers of evil are so overwhelming to man that if the 
Lord forsakes him he will be immersed in all manner of sin and
shame...

If God did not check this deluge there could be no social order 
in existence. Even where the powers of grace are hindered God 
has provided checks against the destruction that wickedness causes.

Some of these checks are common sense, fear of shame, fear of
injury, and a desire for self-respect. But when the judgment of God
is directed against gross wrongs of mankind He withholds the checks 
against the outbreak of sin...

SO!!! Let us always give God the glory that is due Him...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that Your Holy Spirit will one 
day awaken these wayward ones, that they would turn from 
the lusts of their hearts. Help me to be mindful the give You
the honor that is due You. Place your protective hand upon
our troops--and my e-mail friends...Amen.

Keep looking up, seeking His gracious will...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Because of this, God gave them over to their shameful lusts. Even their women exchanged natural relations for unnatural ones. In the same way the men also abandoned natural relations with women and were inflamed with lusts for one another. Men committed indecent acts with other men, and received in themselves the due penalty for their perversion. (Heb. 1:26, 27) NIV
reflection: When people dishonor God, reducing His image to that of man or animals, they sink lower than beasts. They practice iniquity lower than what might be considered that of animals. Not only are the coarse and grossly evil persons guilty of these sins, but learned ones and cultured people also have fallen in similar ways. When such filthy practices make slaves of the educated and the cultured it is evident that the avenger is near.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, There is much need for repentance in the world today. It is just as You predicted it would be many have given themselves over to the lust of the flesh. I pray that there would be a cleansing in the world and that these people would turn once again to righteousness. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~The task ahead of us is never as great 
as the power behind us...

Our Meditation for Today:

Because of this, God gave them over to their shameful lusts.
Even their women exchanged natural relations for unnatural
ones.

In the same way the men also abandoned natural relations
with women and were inflamed with lusts for one another.
Men committed indecent acts with other men, and received 
in themselves the due penalty for their perversion...(Heb. 1:26, 27) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

When people dishonor God, reducing His image to that of man 
or animals, they sink lower than beasts. They practice iniquity 
lower than what might be considered that of animals...

Not only are the coarse and grossly evil persons guilty of these
sins, but learned ones and cultured people also have fallen in 
similar ways...

When such filthy practices make slaves of the educated and the 
cultured it is evident that the avenger is near...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, There is much need for repentance 
in the world today. It is just as You predicted it would be
many have given themselves over to the lust of the flesh.
I pray that there would be a cleansing in the world and that
these people would turn once again to righteousness...Amen.

Keep looking up, for the cleansing power...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Furthermore, since they did not think it worthwhile to retain the knowledge of God, He gave them over to a depraved mind, to do what ought not be done. They have become filled with every kind of wickedness, evil greed and depravity. They are full of envy, murder, strife, deceit, and malice. They are gossips, slanders, God-haters, Insolent, arrogant and boastful; they invent ways of doing evil; they disobey their parents; they are senseless, faithless, heartless, ruthless. Although they know God's righteous decree that those who do such things deserve death, they not only continue to do these very things but also approve of those who practice them. (Ro. 1:28-32) NIV
reflection: Approving wrong identifies the one who approves with the ungodly. Those who do this give evidence of the law of sin that is at work within them. Defending sin, as the unregenerate defend their wrongdoing, is an indication of rebellion against God. The consequences is that rebellion brings the judgement of God, and the wrath of God will rest upon ungodliness. But repentant ones are willing to flee into the city of refuge, through the narrow gate, to be cleansed by the atoning blood of Christ.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, we often point our fingers at the sins of others, but help us to be mindful that in Your eyes sin is sin, there is not one sin better or worse than another. So Lord I thank You for the atoning blood of Jesus Christ for all sin. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~The reason evil enters the lives of many is that, 
there is no commitment to do good...

Our Meditation for Today:

Furthermore, since they did not think it worthwhile to retain 
the knowledge of God, He gave them over to a depraved 
mind, to do what ought not be done...

They have become filled with every kind of wickedness, 
evil greed and depravity. They are full of envy, murder, 
strife, deceit, and malice. 

They are gossips, slanders, God-haters, Insolent, arrogant 
and boastful; they invent ways of doing evil; they disobey 
their parents;

they are senseless, faithless, heartless, ruthless.

Although they know God's righteous decree that those who 
do such things deserve death, they not only continue to do
these very things but also approve of those who practice them.
(Ro. 1:28-32) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Approving wrong identifies the one who approves with the ungodly.
Those who do this give evidence of the law of sin that is at work
within them...

Defending sin, as the unregenerate defend their wrongdoing, is an
indication of rebellion against God. The consequences is that rebellion
brings the judgement of God, and the wrath of God will rest upon
ungodliness...

But repentant ones are willing to flee into the city of refuge, through the 
narrow gate, to be cleansed by the atoning blood of Christ...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, we often point our fingers at the
sins of others, but help us to be mindful that in Your
eyes sin is sin, there is not one sin better or worse than 
another. So Lord I thank You for the atoning blood of 
Jesus Christ for all sin...Amen.

Keep looking up, for every good thing comes from God...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

There will be no devotions the month of June 
as Marcie and I will be gone...

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: You, therefore, have no excuse, you who pass judgement on someone else, for at whatever point you judge the other, you are condemning yourself, because you who pass judgment do the same things. (Ro 2:1) NIV
reflection: The Jews held a favored position as God's chosen people. they had been given the divine law, and knowledge of the true God had been revealed to them. Because of this they were inclined to judge others who did not possess the knowledge they did. Paul warns against this human tendency to judge, it is an inclination that it often used as an attempt to defend oneself and to build personal security. But we need to remember, that we are all guilty before God.
prayer: Dear heavenly Father help us one and all to remember that as we point a finger at someone else, there are three fingers pointing back at us. Forgive me for being judgmental, help me to see my own faults first. Bless and protect my e-mail friends. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Judge not for all are guilty before God

Our Meditation for Today:

You, therefore, have no excuse, you who pass judgement
on someone else, for at whatever point you judge the other, 
you are condemning yourself, because you who pass judgment
do the same things...(Ro 2:1) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

The Jews held a favored position as God's chosen people.
they had been given the divine law, and knowledge of the true
God had been revealed to them...

Because of this they were inclined to judge others who did not
possess the knowledge they did...

Paul warns against this human tendency to judge, it is an
inclination that it often used as an attempt to defend oneself
and to build personal security...

But we need to remember, that we are all guilty before God.

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear heavenly Father help us one and all to remember
that as we point a finger at someone else, there are three
fingers pointing back at us. Forgive me for being judgmental,
help me to see my own faults first...
Bless and protect my e-mail friends...Amen.

Keep looking up, for all things come from God...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Now we know that God's judgment against those who do such things is based on truth. (Ro. 2:2) NIV
reflection: Paul aims his words at the self-deception of supposing that one can deceive God. The Jews reassured themselves on the conclusion that they were children of Abraham, God's covenant people. BUT they would not admit that they disregarded the will of God as revealed in the law. There is a comparison that may be made similarly to nominal Christians who follow outward practices of the church, though their lives indicate defiance of God's ways. They hope to gain eternal life without repentance and the new birth which God offers.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I know that I have sinned against You, so I pray that You would forgive me of my sins of thought, word, and deed. I thank You for Your love and mercy. Watch over my friends I pray in Jesus name. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~One can not inherit eternal life without repentance...

Our Meditation for Today:

Now we know that God's judgment against those who do
such things is based on truth...(Ro. 2:2) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Paul aims his words at the self-deception of supposing that one can
deceive God...

The Jews reassured themselves on the conclusion that they were children
of Abraham, God's covenant people. BUT they would not admit that they 
disregarded the will of God as revealed in the law...

There is a comparison that may be made similarly to nominal Christians
who follow outward practices of the church, though their lives indicate 
defiance of God's ways...

They hope to gain eternal life without repentance and the new birth which 
God offers...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I know that I have sinned against You,
so I pray that You would forgive me of my sins of thought,
word, and deed. I thank You for Your love and mercy. Watch
over my e-mail friends I pray in Jesus name...Amen.

Keep looking up, He's looking down...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: So when you, a mere man, pass judgment on them and yet do the same things, do you think you will escape God's judgment? (Ro. 2:3) NIV
reflection: Paul's reference here is intended to show that judging others cannot avert being judged. Rather, the wrong is magnified when judgment is made against sin that is practiced by the one who judges. Now the favor of God had been directed toward the Jews, and they had experienced much grace, so their judgment would be much more formidable.
prayer: Dear Lord, this country has been blessed in so many ways by Your favor. Each of us have much to be thankful for yet we point fingers at the sins of other nations for their sins, sins of which we too are guilty of. Forgive us Lord for our short-sidedness, I would pray that a revival would begin in this country. Amen.
original_content:
HAVE A NICE DAY!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Judge not lest ye be judged~~~

Our Meditation for Today:

So when you, a mere man, pass judgment on them and 
yet do the same things, do you think you will escape God's
judgment? (Ro. 2:3) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Paul's reference here is intended to show that judging others
cannot avert being judged... Rather, the wrong is magnified 
when judgment is made against sin that is practiced by the 
one who judges...

Now the favor of God had been directed toward the Jews,
and they had experienced much grace, so their judgment 
would be much more formidable...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord, this country has been blessed in so many ways
by Your favor. Each of us have much to be thankful for yet
we point fingers at the sins of other nations for their sins,
sins of which we too are guilty of. Forgive us Lord for our
short-sidedness, I would pray that a revival would begin in
this country...Amen.

Keep looking up and pray for a revival too...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
